name: SysML v2 Hierarchy Extraction
description: Extract the complete part hierarchy showing parent-child containment relationships.
prompt:
Build a hierarchical tree of all parts in this SysML v2 model.

Show the parent-child containment relationships (parts contained within other parts).

Return as an indented text tree or JSON structure showing:
- Top-level parts
- Nested parts within each parent
- The complete containment hierarchy

Example text format:
```
factoryContext
├── Manufacturer
│   ├── Production
│   │   ├── ProductionControl
│   │   └── AngleProductionLine
│   │       ├── Heating
│   │       └── Bending
│   └── Storage
└── Customer
```

Or JSON format:
```json
{"name": "factoryContext", "children": [{"name": "Manufacturer", "children": [...]}]}
```

Include ALL nested parts.

evaluation.rubric: The model defines a factory hierarchy with the following expected structure: factoryContext (root) contains Manufacturer, Customer, and Supplier. Manufacturer contains Production, Storage, Sales, Procurement, ProductionScheduling, and Dispatch. Production contains ProductionControl and AngleProductionLine. AngleProductionLine contains Heating, Bending, Cutting, Drilling, Grinding, and Polishing. The response must show this complete 4-level hierarchy with all 16 parts correctly nested: factoryContext > {Manufacturer > {Production > {ProductionControl, AngleProductionLine > {Heating, Bending, Cutting, Drilling, Grinding, Polishing}}, Storage, Sales, Procurement, ProductionScheduling, Dispatch}, Customer, Supplier}.
